headline: CNN Live Event/Special
subHeadline: Now: House Taking 13th Speaker Vote After McCarthy Flips Holdouts. Aired 2-2:30p ET

utterances.speaker: JOHNSON
utterances.sentences: The gentlewoman is recognized.

utterances.speaker: JOHNSON
utterances.sentences: The reading Clerk will call the roll.SUSAN COLE, READING CLERK OF THE U.S. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES: Adams. REP. ALMA ADAMS, (D-NC): Jeffries.

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: Jeffries. Aderholt. Aderholt. Aguilar.

utterances.speaker: AGUILAR
utterances.sentences: Hakeem Jeffries.

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: Jeffries. Alford.REP. MARK ALFORD, (R-MO): Kevin McCarthy.

utterances.speaker: ALLI
utterances.sentences: McCarthy. Allen.(END VIDEOTAPE) JAKE TAPPER, CNN ANCHOR (voiceover): And it has begun with the announcement of Alma Adams of North Carolina voting for Hakeem Jeffries. The 13th ballot has started. The big question, of course, can Kevin McCarthy, who finally came in first, although not with enough votes to become speaker, can he pick up any more votes he needs? We're not sure whether it's three or four, I believe it's four more votes to become Speaker of the House from his 213 total right now. Can he get any of these seven holdouts to change? Right now, there is obviously a huge effort going on, as Dana Bash says arm twisting. Also, I'm sure it's some encouragement in terms of reelection races and from committee posts and every possible tool at their disposal. I'm told Congressman Patrick McHenry of North Carolina who is a Kevin McCarthy deputy is doing yeoman's work out there trying to convince some of these reluctant individuals. There's Congressman Barr who is one of the big flippers. And we'll see what happens. I am not hearing right now of any news from my sources about any potential flips, but I guess for the McCarthy camp, I hope springs are turning.

utterances.speaker: DANA BASH, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: It's happening. I mean, it's happening, you know, whatever you want to call it. You can even call it good old- fashioned bribery. Yes. And it's all happening on the floor right now. And I got a text from a lawmaker -- a Republican lawmaker in the McCarthy camp as this is starting saying finally, now we just grind it out.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KASIE HUNT, CNN CHIEF NATIONAL AFFAIRS ANALYST
utterances.sentences: Yes. I mean, I can't say this is going --

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: I think they want us to listen to her.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Yes, hold on.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) REP. STEPHANIE BICE, (R-OK): McCarthy.

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: Biggs. Jordan(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: So, Biggs, that's a -- that's a critical one.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Yes. That was one of the seven that we're looking at.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: One of the seven that we are keeping an eye on, and one that they really feel like they need to flip if, in fact, they're going to get where they need to go.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: I can't say this is all going according to plan. It was certainly at least a few days.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: Jeffries. Bishop of North Carolina.REP. DAN BISHOP, (R-NC): McCarthy.

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: McCarthy. Blumenauer.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: The one that we're looking for now after Congresswoman Blunt Rochester is Lauren Boebert. Will she flip? Let's listen in. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: Boebert.REP. LAUREN BOEBERT, (R-CO): Jim Jordan.

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: Jordan.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Jim Jordan. So, right now, two of the seven rebels have stayed rebels.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: Jeffries. Bost.REP. MICHAEL BOST, (R-IL): McCarthy.

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: McCarthy. Bowman.REP. JAMAAL BOWMAN, (D-NY): Jeffries.

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: Jeffries.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: We're going to listen in to see if Congressman-elect Josh Brecheen of Oklahoma is going to stick with his flip to McCarthy. Let's listen in.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: Brecheen.(INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: McCarthy.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: McCarthy. So, he has.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: So, the next one is going to be Crane, alphabetically who's a holdout.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Right. We have a little bit to go.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: So, we have a little bit to go before him.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: That's Cloud actually who will the next one to vote here.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: No, Cloud already turned for McCarthy.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Well, we're --

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: We're double-checking.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: We're double checking to see if they're sticking -- they're sticking with their flip. Yes.

utterances.speaker: JAMIE GANGEL, CNN SPECIAL CORRESPONDENT
utterances.sentences: I think the one thing that is true -- look, there are the seven holdouts, let's see if the blood oath that we heard some members talk about yesterday holds. But the fact that today, McCarthy won over 14 is extraordinary. And I don't think they expected 14. I kept hearing this will go on until Monday.Bash: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GANGEL
utterances.sentences: So --

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: It still might.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: And they have. That -- they have succeeded in that.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: Yes. I mean they have succeeded in them.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Yes. And then in the -- in the 21, including Congresswoman Victoria Spartz voting present. In the 21, they have picked off most of them. Their most 14 flips is big. That is a big achievement. It is not enough. He still needs four more. And we can see what's going to happen.Eli Crane is the one that we're all keeping an eye on right now because cloud and Clyde that we're going to listen to in a second, they already flipped. But Eli Crane is still a holdout despite being a freshman, despite being somebody that Kevin McCarthy helped get elected. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: Casar.REP. GREG CASAR, (D-TX): Hakeem Jeffries.

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: Jeffries. Case.REP. ED CASE, (D-HI): Jeffries.

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: Jeffries. Casten.REP. SEAN CASTEN, (D-IL): Jeffries. (END VIDEO CLIP) ABBY PHILLIP, CNN ANCHOR: This morning, I'll say the former president wasn't making tools with those 20 hardliners I'm told. Let's not get ourselves. That's not the reason that they're voting but I think it's that deal-making that happen overnight. Maybe they are offered something and you know a last-minute push by the former president. He's incredibly popular with a lot of their bases. He could be part of that. And I am told this morning Trump was making calls to these lawmakers.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: And those some interesting comments from McCarthy this morning when he was talking to reporters who asked about whether Steve Scalise could get to 218 and he said I'm not so sure.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: And I wonder how many -- how much conversation has been happening behind the scenes about what that number for McCarthy alternative would really look like and whether that would actually even be a way out of this.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Let's listen in. We want to see if Michael Cloud and Andrew Clyde are going to stick with McCarthy from their flips.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: Cline. Cloud.(INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: McCarthy.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Cloud, McCarthy. He stuck with the flip.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: Clyburn.(INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: Jeffries. Clyde.(INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: McCarthy.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Congressman Andrew Clyde of Georgia sticking with his flip to McCarthy. So, right now I think all eyes -- I think it's fair to say all eyes are on Congressman-elect Crane of Arizona who will be going to come to in a -- in a minute or so because he seems the most likely to flip off the seven rebels, being the most vulnerable, being somebody that actually owes Kevin McCarthy. PHILLIP

utterances.speaker: JOHN KING, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: I think that's a great -- that's a great framing in the sense that for some of these members --

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Hold on. I'm sorry to interrupt.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: NO, I like it.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Let's listen -- let's listen on Congressman-elect Crane.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: Crane.(INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: Jordan.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: And there's the choice, right?

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: So, these -- the new members who ran as sort of Trump acolytes, who ran as rebels, who ran as different than they come into the club and they've been here for a few days now and everyone's trying to tell them you know, listen, that's not the way to succeed here. You got to -- you know you to join the Club. You got to make the trades.And some of -- Congressman-elect Crane there clearly saying at least not yet. No, not yet. That's the choice for the new members. Do I join the Boeberts and the Gaetzs, or do I realize I want committee assignments, I want to courthouse back home, I want to go to some ribbon cuttings, I better make friends and he has decided for now to stay in the outcasts?

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: These are different flavors of Republicans to say --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's a good way to put it.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: To say the least. The next people we're going to be listening for are Bob Good, I don't -- does anybody here think that he's going to change his vote?(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: And then Andy Harris.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: The -- I think one Republican, maybe there are two Republicans now from the state of Maryland. And the question is whether or not he is -- he is going to flip. I would look at him maybe more than any of the others left on the -- on the holdout list. And the other thing I just think we need to -- and we're not -- we don't know exactly right now. You're going to have to keep focusing on what else did McCarthy promise.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Oh, that's the huge -- that is the huge deal.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: What did he give?

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: Melanie Zanona, our colleague on the Hill is reporting about a promise to cap defense spending.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Cap it or cut it? I thought it was cut 75 billion.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Let's hold on and listen to see if Congressman Byron Donalds, a former rebel is sticking with his McCarthy's backing.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: Donalds.(INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Yes. So, Congressman Donalds is apparently not there.

utterances.speaker: BASH
utterances.sentences: Not currently in the room.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: He's been involved in the negotiations, so you've seen that some -- you know some of them are in the meetings they when they realize their name was called then come in and they cast their vote. A couple of different ways to look at this. One is, Jake, you made the point earlier that Chip Roy delivered his group.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: He said he had them and that they wanted substantive policy rules changes.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: So, one way to look at that is Ken McCarthy's made huge progress today. Another way to look at that is he -- why did he -- you know if he knew the -- if he did the math if he had a good sense of the math, why weren't those deals negotiated between Election Day and you know the new Congress convening? There's certainly been miscalculations by the McCarthy camp as to this -- you know, 10, 12 humiliations. However, however, with significant progress today, you hope all that from the rearview mirror if you're in the Kevin McCarthy camp. The question is if you have the good Boebert, Gaetz, Crane, and a couple of other nevers, is there any way? How do you do the chest then? There's never mean you will always vote for somebody by name or can you convince them OK, we get it, vote present, you know lower the numbers, play the chess. That will be the next negotiation. If they refused to come over like the other holdout, is there any way to negotiate for them to go out of town --

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Go vote present --

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Or do something that might sound ridiculous, but it would -- it might be the only way to get Kevin McCarthy to the number. He has made significant progress today but he has not made enough. He is still not a speaker.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Well, and this is part of why the next couple of hours are so incredibly critical for Kevin McCarthy here because if for whatever reason he cannot make any more movement here, we are going to start to learn more about those concessions that Dana was talking about. What is it exactly that has been given away? And that risks angering all of these people that have stood with him so far through all of this.Right now, it seems like the ball is rolling. If they can keep it rolling, there's still a chance. And again, we're waiting to hear for Harris to be -- to be called here, in the Hs. We're currently in the Fs. He would be kind of the last one I would expect to potentially change on this vote. I mean, the others seem to be absolutely never, Gaetz obviously, at the top of that list. But if there's no movement on this vote, and these are -- these holdouts still are refusing --

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Hold on one second, let me just interrupt. We need -- here's Matt Gaetz.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: Gaetz.(INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: Jordan.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Voted for Jim Jordan. Sorry, keep on.

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: No, no, it's -- I mean, that's exactly to the point that we were just making here. I mean, I just think that the next couple of hours are so incredibly critical. And if they let this Congress walk away from Washington over the weekend, as there's going to be increasing pressure to do, I think all bets may be off in terms of what we've seen, kind of unfold today.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: What also strikes me about what we do know -- what little we do frankly about some of the concessions is some of these are not things to keep for Kevin McCarthy to give away. He cannot unilaterally decide what defense spending levels are. He also cannot unilaterally decide --

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: Such a good point.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: Whether there's going to be a clean debt limit increase. So, he's kind of giving away maybe the case that he's going to fight for these things on their behalf but he cannot really promise some of those things, which might be a great loophole if you're Kevin McCarthy, or it might be a straitjacket.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Well, he can say I'll support it -- I'll support it.

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: Yes. But --

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: But that's not to say that the Senate --

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: That's not to say that it's going to happen.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: The Senate won't put that money back --

utterances.speaker: PHILLIP
utterances.sentences: And there are all kinds of things that he can say he supports that may not ever.

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Let's hold on and listen for Bob Good, a never-Kevin from Virginia who comes after Vicente.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: Good of Virginia.REP. BOB GOOD, (R-VA): Jim Jordan.

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: Jordan.(END VIDEO CLIP) (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: TAPPER
utterances.sentences: Jordan. So, that's it. Already, McCarthy has lost five votes and I believe he's only able to lose four to become a speaker of the House. So, it looks like he will lose on the 13th ballot as well, although he has made some progress. And it looks as though all the people who flipped in the 12th ballot are staying with him in the 13th ballot. Still, no indication that he has picked up any of these seven rebels and he needs at least three or four of them to become a speaker. I believe it's four, although the math depends on how many people are actually on the floor of the House, and then he won one ballot.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: COLE
utterances.sentences: Green of Texas.REP. AL GREEN, (D-TX): I cast my vote on behalf of the thousands of black people who are (INAUDIBLE) in our country. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: HUNT
utterances.sentences: So, next is Harris.

utterances.speaker: ANDERSON COOPER, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Jake Tapper, thanks very much. As they continue to watch the counting of the votes, it doesn't seem like -- I mean, obviously, he's already got enough against him on this vote. So, what happens, David?

utterances.speaker: DAVID AXELROD, CNN SENIOR POLITICAL COMMENTATOR
utterances.sentences: Well, I mean, look, they've got -- this is where -- this is the point we always thought we might reach which is that there were those who are gettable and there were those who may not be. And you know, you heard Gaetz earlier -- Representative Gaetz, we don't know -- you know how much credence to put in this saying he'll not have the vote today, tomorrow, next week. And The question is will they hang together?

utterances.speaker: COOPER
utterances.sentences: What is happening?(INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: DAVID URBAN, CNN POLITICAL COMMENTATOR
utterances.sentences: Harris just flipped.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: KAREN FINNEY, CNN POLITICAL COMMENTATOR
utterances.sentences: Well, that seems to be -- that's going to have to be the strategy for the rest of the day, just try to pick one by one by one by one.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: AXELROD
utterances.sentences: There may be some subcommittee chairs and committee chairs born in the next 48 hours.

utterances.speaker: SCOTT JENNINGS, CNN SENIOR POLITICAL COMMENTATOR
utterances.sentences: One guy I'm watching is Rosendale with Montana. I just think you can't -- you can't downplay the significance of the Senate primary politics going on. Montana will be one of the biggest pickup opportunities for the Republicans in 24. Zinke and Rosendale from Montana, the two reps are circling each other on that race.If I were Ryan's Zinke, and I wanted to be a mischief-maker, I get on the phone with Montana media right now and say every time Rosendale casts a vote to prolong this, he's essentially voting with the Democrats to protect Joe Biden from our subpoenas and our investigations, of all the issues going on out there that are motivating for the Republican base. The notion of somehow delaying or not investigating Joe Biden would be the most agitating. So, you want to get like hyper-local and how to twist the knife here in Montana, that's a way.

utterances.speaker: AXELROD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Well, that's the drum Marjorie Taylor (INAUDIBLE). The leader of the -- the leader McCarthy forces.

utterances.speaker: FINNEY
utterances.sentences: I don't want to get it or argue that is exactly what the American people voted against. I mean, again, we have -- we're going micro to macro. You're right. That's a smart Senate strategy if you're running in Montana. But again, I think this is a misreading of the results of the election by, no surprise, by Marjorie Taylor Greene and others. And the question becomes, you know, as we've been talking about this, in terms of negotiation it's not just how do we get to yes, but the question is for the seven, what is a win look like?

utterances.speaker: JENNINGS
utterances.sentences: Can I ask you a question? Do you really think the American people want no oversight of the administration? Because while I hear you on is it the only thing you do, I do think voters expect Congress, a coequal branch of government can do something which the Democrats have done nothing for two years. Don't you think there's some of it is real?

utterances.speaker: FINNEY
utterances.sentences: Actually, I would -- I would challenge you on that and say that the January 6 committee has actually completely re-established what it is to do oversight by holding a series of hearings where we actually learn fundamentally new, expository information that changed our understanding of what happened.

utterances.speaker: JENNINGS
utterances.sentences: Address?

utterances.speaker: FINNEY
utterances.sentences: I do not think that we're going to hear that in any hearings regarding Hunter Biden's laptop, nor do I think it's going to be when we're looking at whether or not the FBI is looking too much in the white supremacy.

utterances.speaker: JENNINGS
utterances.sentences: Karen, I think Americans want to have an exposition and a full-throttle explanation of our withdrawal from Afghanistan. I think that's something that America deserves to have. So, I think that there's -- you know you can't -- you can't throw the baby with the bathwater.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: AXELROD
utterances.sentences: Look, I agree. I think oversight is legitimate and important if it's -- if it's entered into in good faith. If it's become sort of a search and destroy mission, then I think people -- and this is what people fear. And --

utterances.speaker: MARGARET HOOVER, CNN POLITICAL COMMENTATOR
utterances.sentences: When we had a House of Representatives that was Republican that conducted an oversight in the last administration, the Benghazi oversight, right, run by Trey Gowdy, a totally responsible lawyer who had respect from both the extreme wing of the Republican faction then, and the moderates. We saw where that led. You've got an entirely different makeup of the Republican House of Representatives coming into this Congress, and you're going to get a very different caliber and quality of exposition. And, frankly, oversight, which is going to be, you know, on steroids in terms of its performative value, in terms of its -- of its seriousness, or lack thereof. So, you're just going to see a very different kind of "governing." And that is, frankly going to play into you all hands in a very positive way.(CROSSTALK)
